metadata.title: squid: Denial of Service in SSL Certificate validation (important)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: The MITRE CVE dictionary describes this issue as: Squid is a caching proxy for the Web. Due to an Improper Validation of Specified Index bug, Squid versions 3.3.0.1 through 5.9 and 6.0 prior to 6.4 compiled using `--with-openssl` are vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack against SSL Certificate validation. This problem allows a remote server to perform Denial of Service against Squid Proxy by initiating a TLS Handshake with a specially crafted SSL Certificate in a server certificate chain. This attack is limited to HTTPS and SSL-Bump. This bug is fixed in Squid version 6.4. In addition, patches addressing this problem for the stable releases can be found in Squid's patch archives. Those who you use a prepackaged version of Squid should refer to the package vendor for availability information on updated packages. 
            
            MITIGATION: Disable the use of SSL-Bump features:
- Remove all ssl-bump options from http_port and https_port
- Remove all ssl_bump directives from squid.conf

Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
